turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You are still the best knight in Christiandom. You gained a hundred advantages over me. It is I who must love you, for through your courage and patience you taught me a bitter lesson.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Then make me your champion and I will always fight in your place.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: But your life and lands are far from here.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: I gave up my castles and my lands!

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: My domain is here, inside this metal skin. And I would pledge to you all that I still own: muscle, bone, blood and the heart that pumps it.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: And a great heart it is. Sir Lancelot, you will be my champion.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Lancelot, how did you fare in the North?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: We spared the lives of a few, so they could sail home and tell their fellows what fate they met at the hands of King Arthur's knights...

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: These men repented before God for their evil deeds. Those who would not, met their fate at the end of my sword.  Accept the fruit of my first quest as my wedding gift.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I do. Rise, Lancelot, come with me.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Your deeds set an example for all other knights. For your gift, ask a gift of me.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Only give me leave to ride out again, to do what I am most able to do, and happiest doing.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: They miss the battlefield. I think we do too.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: But one can still keep a sword sharp riding out in the name of the King's law.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Hasn't Merlin mended your wound?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: It is deep...

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Arthur.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Lancelot, I will save you... Don't die.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: My salvation is to die a Knight of the Round Table.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You are that and much more. You are its greatest knight, you are what is best in men. Now we will be together--

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: --It is the old wound, that has been opened. I have always known it would be the gateway to my death, for it has never healed. Let my heart do its job, my King, and pump me empty...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: At last...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Don't recognize him. You were trapped by Morgana's sorcery.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: ...Gawain and Perceval, Bors and Bohort, Caradoc and Ector, and all the others--lost to me. Only the echo of their voices remains in this empty hall. All I have left is the memory of their fellowship. Echoes and memories. I am a ghost of the King that once was...  ...Mordred is real, alive, my own flesh and blood. I will see him, I must.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Perceval, you have returned!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Ready my knights for battle; they will ride with their King once more. I have lived through others far too long! Lancelot carried my honor and Guenevere my guilt. My knights have fought my causes. Mordred carries my sins. Now, at last, I will rule.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Merlin, will I live...?  ...I was dreaming...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Of Merlin?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yes. He spoke to me. He said I would fight bravely tomorrow. I have never dreamed of Merlin before.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I dreamed of him too... Merlin lives! He lives in our dreams now, in that dark and shadowy place that is as strong and real as this more solid one. He speaks to us from there.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: He can be no other.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Lancelot?... It is Lancelot!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Who is Merlin?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Speak of the devil!...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Whose son am I?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You are the son of King Uther, and the fair Igrayne... you are King Arthur.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You saved me from the arrow...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: But not from your destiny.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I want to thank you.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: That's not why you came.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Merlin, help me. I need your help. I don't know how--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: 'Help me, Help me.' Help me get up.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: It is whispered in the forest that...  ...Leondegrance's castle is under siege by Lot and Uryens.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Yes, yes, I know that. Everybody does. Lord Leondegrance is my only ally among the barons and the great knights. I can't lose him.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Well there. You don't need me half as much as you think you do. You already know what must not happen.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I must find the means to save him, then. I was hoping I could ask you for a little magic help, but if it makes you so tired...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: It's just that I have no experience, and no men to speak of. How can I--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Because you must! You and only you. Have you forgotten that it was you who freed Excalibur?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: How? Where?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: In the great book.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: What book is that?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: The book without pages. Open before you, all around us. You can see it in bits and pieces, for if mortal men were to see it whole and all complete in a single glance, why, it would burn him to cinders.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: The dragon! There...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Then as knight to knight I can offer you mercy.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What's this, what's this?!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: A king must marry, after all.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: ...of course...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I love her. If she would be my queen, my dreams would be answered.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: There are maidens as fair, and fairer than Guenevere. If I put my mind to it, I could see them now, many of them, weeping for love of you, watching the hills for you coming from the high towers of their castles. Offering you their every favor. Rich, clever--but if it is to be Guenevere, so be it.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Who will it be? Put your mind to it, then.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Guenevere. And a beloved friend who will betray you.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Guenevere...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You're not listening. Your heart is not. Love is deaf as well as blind.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I should have left you to fend for yourself.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I had to weave a little enchantment on the bees so I could get some honey, and I didn't feel up to using any more magic just yet. Anyway, I was in less danger than you'll be in today.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: So you were stealing their honey. They should have killed you.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Come now. So much anger for such a little crime? Are you sure there is nothing else troubling you?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You know full well there is, and I go to meet it now. Come witness my revenge.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Excalibur! Is it true?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: The Lady of the Lake. Take it. Take it, quickly!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: The knights of Galys approach the camp. It would be politic...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: ...to ride out and meet them.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: At your service, sir.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Then answer me this. For years peace has reigned in the land. Crops grow in abundance, there is no want. Every one of my subjects enjoys his portion of happiness and justice, even those whose tiresome misunderstandings we must resolve here each day. Tell me, Merlin: have we defeated evil, as it seems?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Good and evil; there is never one without the other.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Where hides evil, then, in my kingdom?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Never where you expect it, that's all I know.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Merlin, tell me. Now that Guenevere is returned to me...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What is it my child?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Just yes? No mad laughter, no riddles, nothing but a simple yes? That frightens me.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: A king should be afraid, always. The enemy is everywhere. Waiting in ambush in the dark corridors of his castle, on the deer paths of his forest, or in the gray and winding paths of a more tangled forest, in here.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What?  The greatest? They blend together like the metals we mix to make a good sword.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I didn't ask for poetry. Which is it?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I am alone and betrayed. By my wife, by my beloved friend, by my knights. And by you. Perhaps most of all by you. For you made me, you forged this wretched life. And like a child tired of a toy, you toss me aside, a babbling lecher trotting after my sister...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: That is my destiny. I have a destiny, too...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: With all your powers, you are content to be ridiculed, laughed at...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: My powers fade, Arthur. I resort to cheap tricks...  Yes! I enjoy every moment of my foolishness, I join in the making of it, so no one can betray me. But you! You betray yourself.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Me? I have lived by the oath of king and knight.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You betray the boy who drew the sword, the boy who saw the Dragon... the Dragon who moves close by, coiling and uncoiling, restless, looking down, waiting for the King to be a king...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I must do it myself. I must kill them both. Lancelot and Guenevere. Will you ride with me, Merlin?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I cannot. I must not. Here I must stay.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Quiet. You'll wake the men, and they must fight tomorrow for their very lives.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I know. I have heard noises and echoes through the stones...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: What is this place, Merlin?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: It is like a tree. The roots of the stones spread out across the land and they draw on the thoughts and actions of men. Like sap those human matters course through the stones feeding the stars that are the leaves of the tree. And the stars whisper back to men the future course of events.  But the earth is being torn apart, its metals stolen, and the balance is broken and the lines of power no longer converge. In fact, I nearly didn't make it in one piece.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: But, I'm here.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Where have you been these many years? Is it true that Morgana--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: --Stories... You brought me back. Your love brought me back. Back to where you are now, in the land of dreams...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Is this a dream? Tell me, Merlin!

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: Father...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Rise, Mordred.

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: I have come to claim what is mine, Father.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I recognize you only as my son, no more.

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: And you are the great King? The lords have rebelled. Invaders attack the coasts. Crops don't grow. There is nothing but plague and hunger in the land. Only I am feared. I will be king. You may have lost Excalibur, but I have found my own weapon of power. There.

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: The very spear that pierced the side of Christ as he died on the cross.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Your mother told you that?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I cannot offer you the land, only my love...

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: And I offer only this, Father. To commit with passion and pleasure all the evils that you failed to commit, as man and king.

turns.speaker: MORDRED
turns.text: I will muster a great force of knights, and I will return to fight for what is mine.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: So be it.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I left it in the tent, sir.

turns.speaker: SIR ECTOR
turns.text: Well hurry then, and get it.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Sir... Kay needed a sword. His was stolen. I saw Excalibur, and... I took it.

turns.speaker: SIR ECTOR
turns.text: You freed it, son?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I did, Father. I beg your forgiveness.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Who is, then?

turns.speaker: SIR ECTOR
turns.text: I don't know. Merlin brought you to me when you were newly born and charged me to raise you as my own. At first, I did so because I feared Merlin, later because I loved you.

turns.speaker: SIR ECTOR
turns.text: He is the mightiest and fairest of knights.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: We fought and won battles, and now one man defeats all my knights? I will go.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: It didn't hurt too much, did it?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Ye...

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: --I'm pretty good at stitchery. I've sewn my father's wounds more than once.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: But I have to leave tomorrow. The forests are thick with rebels, invaders plunder our shores...

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: --And damsels in besieged castles are waiting to be rescued?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I didn't know Leondegrance had a daughter.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Well, then, I shall tell you which knights have maiden daughters, so you can avoid their castles.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: No, I think it's better if you just stay here to heal. At least a week.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I'm going.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Quiet, or I'll sew up your mouth too.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: He must stay for the feasting days of our wedding, and tell his deeds himself.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I grant you your wish if you grant Lady Guenevere hers.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I will ride with Sir Kay. Lancelot, rest here.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Don't start a war on my wedding day!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Without Lancelot?!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Sir Gahalt, answer the Queen.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: No. I meant not to be angry with you, Sir Gahalt. In the idleness that comes with peace gossip has bread its own evil. You merely repeat it. Please, sir, have one of those apples that Lancelot loves, and in that gesture partake of its goodness.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: The Queen will be in my charge till a champion steps forward to fight on her behalf.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Not you, my husband?

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Why can't you be my champion?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: If I am your judge, I cannot be your champion. When I act as your King, I cannot be your husband.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: And you cannot love me...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: The laws, my laws, must bind everyone, high and low, or they are not laws at all. Lancelot will come...

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: And if he cannot be found, no other knight will champion me, though you beseeched each and every one of them. Why be king if there is no one you can call loyal subject but an eager boy?

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten; and because it will not be forgotten, that fair time may come again. Now once more I must ride with my knights to defend what was, and the dream of what could be.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: I have kept it.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: Who does it serve?

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: You, my lord.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: Because you and the land are one.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: The well-kept secret is whether any of them has won your heart.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: I am a fighting man and I am married to the quest. That is enough.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: And there is no maiden in the whole world who inspires you?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: There is one.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Who?!

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Yes. I would swear my love to you.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: To me? But why?

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: I cannot love as a woman the lady who will be wife to my King and my friend. And, in pledging my love to you, I cannot love any other woman.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: The law forbids it.

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: Love demands it.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: There are things about love--

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: --Nothing!

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Why didn't he kill us?

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: He has given up.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: The King without his sword, the land without a king...

turns.speaker: GUENEVERE
turns.text: We are to blame.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Just a man. A knight in the King's service.

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: You're a man?!  ...with metal skin!

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Very well. Climb up.

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: I will run.

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: Listen, boy, it's more than twenty days from here.

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: Twenty days!? The world is that big?

turns.speaker: PERCEVAL
turns.text: I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...

turns.speaker: LANCELOT
turns.text: --It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You left your husband's side? You left your brother's wedding?

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: Is that Mandrake, Lord Merlin?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: It is.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: Can it truly be used for magic?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: No, no, of course not. You are young...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I'm not jealous!

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: It's clear you are, and it irks me.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: No. Yes, I am. I am jealous. I want to write poems about you with moonbeams, make the sea sing your name...

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: A lovestruck page!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Shh... yes, yes. Sit with me, please... Morgana.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I showed you all my conjuring tricks...

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: The deepest secrets, the forbidden formulas...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Maybe... maybe...

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: You know what I want. I want the secret of true magic, how to thicken the stuff of dreams and wishes with the flesh of the world.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: That I cannot.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: When Arthur built the castle, I carved out a place for myself, where I could laugh or sleep, and no one would bother me.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: People make you laugh?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: They do.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: You are truly magnificent!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Flattery! Do you think I am ignorant of your stupid little games? Preying on you weakness of others. That's your power, a petty evil. Mine is great. Great plans. Impossible dreams. Laughable endings...

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: Merlin, the powers of Summoning, the true Name of the charms of Doing and Undoing. Show me!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I won't. You would misuse such power. I have paid enough for you, and I will have you.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What do you want? You must desire it for me to weave it.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: Walls of shining crystals, burning with red fire, furnishings of metals and jewels never seen by man...

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: You provoke me, Merlin.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What's behind that beauty? A wizened, cold-hearted snake.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I am the cloudburst that quenches the flames.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: I am the desert, where water disappears--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: --I am the sea, which covers the desert forever under its weight.

turns.speaker: MORGANA
turns.text: --I am the fog and mists that rise up from the sea, escaping...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: It's done. A truce. We meet at the river.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: Talk. Lovers murmuring to each other...

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: I should butcher all and every one of them. Merlin, what is this wagging of tongues?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Just show the sword.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Behold the sword of power, Excalibur. Before Uther, it belonged to Lud, before Lud, to Beowulf, before Beowulf to Baldur the Good, before Baldur to Thor himself and that was when the world was young and there were more than seven colors in the rainbow.  Speak the words.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: One land, one king! That is my peace!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I have walked my way since the beginning of time. Sometimes I give, sometimes I take. It is mine to know which, and when.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: Dumb riddles, Merlin. I am your King.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: I swear it. By Excalibur and the holy--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: --What issues from your lust will be mine. Swear it again.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: I swear it.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: Merlin! Out of the sick sleep at last.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Doing what I did for you, it wasn't easy, you know. It takes it's toll. It took nine moons to get back my strength.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Now you must pay me.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: I?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: The child is mine, Uther. I have come for him.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: The oath. You didn't say--

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You didn't ask!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: It's not for you, Uther, hearth and home, wife and child.

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: To kill and be king, is that all?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Maybe not even that, Uther. I thought once that you were the one to unite the land under one sword. But it'll take another, a greater king...

turns.speaker: UTHER
turns.text: You strike me with words as hard as steel.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: They are not weapons, my friend, but truths. You betrayed the Duke, stole his wife and took his castle, now no one trusts you. Lot, Uryens, your allies will turn against you. Give me the child, Uther, I will protect him. Go back to your war tent.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Burke take a look at this damn thing it just doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Why it's perfectly plain, your the teacher at the college, you don't want the building torn down.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: C'mon I can read for Christ sake.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Well what's wrong?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well why are they tearing the building down?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Shall we summon the writer? He's in Paris I believe.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hiding?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What honey?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Fuck it.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Well, he does know the background. I doubt there's any danger in just having him assist. There should be a psychiatrist present, anyway.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: And what about the exorcist? Any ideas?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: How about Lankaster Merrin.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: Merrin? I had notion he was over in Iraq. I think I read he was working on a dig around Nineveh.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: That's right Mike. But he's finished and came back around three ot four months ago, He's in Woodstock now.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: What's he doing there? Teaching?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: No, he's working on another book.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: Don't you think he's too old, though? How's his health?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: It must be alright. He's still running around digging up tombs. Besides, he's had experience.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Ten maybe twelve years ago, in Africa. The exorcism supposedly lasted for months. I heard it damn near killed him.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: You're convinced that it's genuine.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I don't know. No, not really I suppose. But I've made a prudent judgement that it meets the conditions set down in the Ritual.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: You'd want to do the exorcism yourself?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: It might be best to have a man with experience. Maybe someone who's spent time in the foreign missions.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I see, your excellency.

turns.speaker: CARDINAL
turns.text: Let's see whose around. In the meantime I'll call you as soon as I know.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Thank you your excellency.

turns.speaker: CLINIC DIRECTOR
turns.text: Quite frankly, we don't know much about it except that it's starts with some conflict or guilt that eventually leads to the patient's delusion that his body's been invaded by an alien intellegence; a spirit if you will.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Look, I'm telling you again and you'd better believe it, I'm not about to put her in a goddamn asylum!

turns.speaker: CLINIC DIRECTOR
turns.text: It's-

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: And I don't care what you call it! I'm not putting her away!

turns.speaker: CLINIC DIRECTOR
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You're sorry. Christ, eighty-eight doctors and all you can tell me is all of your bullshit...

turns.speaker: CLINIC DIRECTOR
turns.text: It's a stylized ritual in which rabbis or priests try to drive out the so-called invading spirit. It's pretty much discarded these days, except by the Catholics who keep it in the closet as a sort of embarrassment. It has worked, in fact, although not for the reason they think, of course. It was purely the force of suggestion. The victim's belief in possession helped cause it; and just in the same way this belief in the power of exorcism can make it disappear.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You're telling me that, I should take my daughter to a witch doctor? Is that it?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: In here!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hi

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Hi, how'd your day go?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh not to bad, kinda like the Walt Disney version of the Ho Chi Minh story, but other than that it was terrific.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh great, anything else?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: And you got an invitation.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Dinner at the White House.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Your kidding me. What is it a big party or something?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Just five or six people.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No kidding.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hello? Yes this is Mrs. MacNeil. Operator you have got to be kidding I have been on this line for twenty minutes.  Jesus Christ, can you believe this, he doesn't even call his daughter on her birthday for christ sake.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Maybe the circuit is busy?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh circuit my ass, he doesn't give a shit!

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Why don't you let me?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What the hell do you mean going out and leaving Regan by her self! What are you kidding her window's wide open...

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What didn't he tell you?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Didn't who tell me?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Burke.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What's Burke got to do with it?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Well, when I went to get the Thorazine I had him to stay with her and... Oh, I should of known better.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah, well I guess you should've.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What did the doctor say?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: We have to start looking for a shrink.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh Burke! Poor Burke!

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: This was under Regan's pillow. Did you put it there?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Of course I didn't.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Where do you want this?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Phonograph.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Storage.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I'm gonna miss you.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Sure you won't change your mind?

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Does your daughter remember if perhaps Mr. Dennings was in her room in her room that night?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No, she was heavily sedated.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: It's serious?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yes, I'm affraid it is.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: May I ask...?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: We still don't know.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Watch out for drafts. A draft in the fall when the house is hot is a magic carpet for bacteria.
